 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נֵרְדְּ‎</span> **noun masculine**, ==nard==, an odorific plant from India (***via*** Persia) (Sanskrit <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***naladâ***</u></abbr>; Persian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***nârdîn***</u></abbr>; Sabean, Arabic transposed <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> according to [[BDB#DHM|DHM]]<sup>Burgen u. Schlosser 975 (SB xcvii)</sup> see also [[BDB#SabDenkm|SabDenkm]]<sup>82</sup>; Greek <span class="bdbLangGreek">νάρδος</span> [so [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]]] (through Semites) [[BDB#Lewy|Lewy]]<sup>Fremdwörter 40</sup>; compare [[BDB#Löw|Löw]]<sup>No. 316</sup> [[BDB#Lag|Lag]]<sup>M. ii. 25</sup>); — absolute <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נ‎</span> [[Song.4.14|Song 4:14]] suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִרְדִּי תַן רֵיחוֺ‎</span> [[Song.1.12|Song 1:12]] plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְרָדִים‎</span> [[Song.4.13|Song 4:13]]. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נֵרִיָּה‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נֵר‎</span> below <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נור‎</span>
